awd_abstract_narration: This research is concerned with the development of a                       stochastic optimization modeling approach that supports the                     evaluation and the analysis of global manufacturing strategies                  under uncertainty.  The research project will introduce a                       normative model that considers risk and return tradeoffs                        throughout the world supply chain network.                                           The sources of uncertainty to be considered include currency               fluctuations, market demand variation and price risk.  Tradeoffs                occur through corporate taxes and transfer prices; duties and                   tariffs; production and transportation costs; the cost of                       manufacturing flexibility; global financing costs; and                          international pricing differences.  Decisions concerning facility               size and location, material flows, product mix, overhead cost                   allocation, financing and pricing will be accounted for in the                  model framework.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
